qas.question: Part 1 of the AAI introductory immunology course is meant to be what?

answers.text: an introduction to the basic principles of immunology

qas.question: Part 2 of the AAI introductory immunology course revolves around what?
What pre-requisite should enrollees in the advanced immunology course have?

answers.text: a background of the principles of immunology

qas.question: How long does it typically take to earn a Master's degree?
What program requires an additional two years of study?

context: In addition, this Introductory Course gives students more information to complement general biology or science training. It also has two different parts: Part I is <a0_0>an introduction to the basic principles of immunology<a0_0/> and Part II is a <a1_0>clinically-oriented lecture series<a1_0/>. On the other hand, the Advanced Course is another course for those who are willing to expand or update their understanding of immunology. It is advised for students who want to attend the Advanced Course to have <a2_0>a background of the principles of immunology<a2_0/>. Most schools require students to take electives in other to complete their degrees. A Master’s degree requires <a3_0>two years of study<a3_0/> following the attainment of a bachelor's degree. For <a4_0>a doctoral programme<a4_0/> it is required to take two additional years of study.
